The chief landmarks of Gagra are:

value: ruins of the Abaata fortress (4th-5th century AD, built by the Anchabadze dynasty-ruling Georgian dynasty);
6th-century church, said to be the oldest in Abkhazia, built by Anchabadze dynasty;
Mamdzyshkha - mountain height of 1873 meters in 6 km from Gagra, provide great views over surrounding countryside;
19th-century palace of the Prince of Oldenburg.
